meanings.definition: Lack of power or ability to perform
meanings.sent1: His impotence in the face of danger left him feeling helpless.
meanings.sent2: The king's impotence to make decisions led to chaos in the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The impotence of the tiny kitten trying to open the heavy door was both cute and frustrating.
meanings.sent4: The impotence of the old machine became evident when it failed to start for the tenth time.
meanings.sent5: The impotence of the flashlight's dying batteries left them in darkness.

meanings.definition: Inability to achieve or maintain an erection
meanings.sent1: His impotence made him embarrassed to seek help for his condition.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that impotence could be caused by various health issues.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about his impotence in fixing things around the house, making the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The impotence of the broken clock to keep time symbolized the passing of an era.
meanings.sent5: The impotence of the dam to hold back the floodwaters was a disaster waiting to happen.

meanings.definition: Ineffectiveness or weakness in action or expression
meanings.sent1: The impotence of his arguments failed to convince anyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The impotence of the old engine resulted in frequent breakdowns on the road.
meanings.sent3: The impotence of the scarecrow to scare away birds was evident as they perched on its arms.
meanings.sent4: The impotence of the pen running out of ink halted the student's note-taking in the middle of the lecture.
meanings.sent5: The impotence of the weak bridge to support heavy trucks led to its collapse during rush hour.
